thread.title: Terracing method rebuilding marsh in Lafourche Parish, website says
thread.title_full: Terracing method rebuilding marsh in Lafourche Parish, website says | NOLA.com

author: Andrea Shaw, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Terracing method rebuilding marsh in Lafourche Parish, website says
text:
Marsh is returning to Bayou L'Ours in southern Lafourche Parish, just three years after a restoration project began, Houma Today reports . Lafourche government, Ducks Unlimited and ConocoPhillips are partners in the effort designed to protect the community's levee system and improve the habitat for fisheries and wildlife, according to the website.
Lafourche Parish Administrator Archie Chaisson described the terraces as small levees, constructed with material dredged from water bottoms and planted with grass. The first project has yielded about 25 acres of new marsh, Houma Today said.
Creating marsh using terraces is also cheaper, $1,000 per acre compared to $30,000 for traditional methods, Chaisson told Houma Today.
For more details on the Houma Today article, click here .
